concept.deftn: the nature or the genre of a resource

outline.deftn: primary source materials from the Archives that do not fall under any other title type, such as correspondence, newsletter, or transcript

a self-contained composition on a fairly narrow topic or subject, written by one or more authors and published or submitted for publication in a magazine, journal, proceedings, encyclopedia, or newsletter
recorded auditory material that can be heard by the human ear
a list resources or the headings treated in a work with references for accessing the indicated information
a written work or composition that has been published and bound as a single volume
one of two or more major divisions of a book, each complete in itself but related in theme or structure to the division preceding and/or following it
an evaluative account of a book, usually written by a qualified person for publication in a newspaper, magazine, or journal.
a book or numbered set of books containing authoritative summary information about a variety of topics in the form of short essays, usually arranged alphabetically
a single visual representation or a series of related images, which create the illusion of movement when viewed in rapid succession
a series of related images, which create the illusion of movement when viewed in rapid succession
materials designed to respond to input from a human being, usually in the form of commands, data and/or actions

Journal: a periodical devoted to disseminating original research and commentary on current developments in a specific discipline, subdiscipline, or field of study; Magazine: a popular interest periodical usually containing articles on a variety of topics, written by various authors in a nonscholarly style; Periodical: a serial publication with its own distinctive title, containing a mix of articles, editorial, reviews, columns, short stories, poems, or other short works written by more than one contributor, generally published at regular stated intervals of less than a year
a book used as a reference in the operation of a task, computer program, procedure, job or other function
a written and, traditionally, unpublished work or composition

a serial publication consisting of no more than a few pages, devoted to news, announcements, and current information that is of interest primarily to a specialized group of subscribers or members of an association or organization
a visual medium created to publicize a forthcoming event or communicate scholarly or scientific work, with or without illustration
a broadcast, podcast, or formal representation of ideas communicated in person or via the Internet
a record of research findings, research still in progress, documentation or other technical findings; also includes NCAR Technotes
a computer program, application, or model that must be run on a computer server
a written document on a particular subject in which one has done original research that is for a diploma or degree
the written record of words spoken in a speech, interview, broadcast, sound recording or other proceedings
a specification that defines the properties and values of a metadata format
